definition: Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals

sentences.english: Will Premier Wen press Abe to make commitment of not visiting the Yasukuni Shrine?
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶總理是否會讓安倍作出不參拜靖國神社的承諾？

sentences.english: The key point of the worship is negating history and justifying Japan's military aggression.
sentences.chinese: 而參拜靖國神社就是爲了把軍國主義侵略史正當化。

sentences.english: The Anima Shrine, but legends say that it was built in order to.
sentences.chinese: 該動物靖國神社，但傳說中指出，這是建立在以。

sentences.english: How many post-war Japanese prime ministers have visited the Yasukuni Shrine?
sentences.chinese: 戰後日本有多少首相曾去靖國神社參拜？

sentences.english: Yasukuni Shrine is the spiritual pillar of Japanese militarist aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖國神社是日本軍國主義對外侵略擴張的精神支柱。

sentences.english: The Japanese leaders insisted on visiting the Yasukuni Shrine that worships Class-A war criminals during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 日本領導人堅持參拜供奉甲級戰犯的靖國神社。

sentences.english: The shrine becomes ransacked by one of the evil princes, Atmos.
sentences.chinese: 靖國神社成爲洗劫一個邪惡王子，大氣。

sentences.english: Yasuguni Shrine has become a spiritual pillar of Japanese militarists' policy of aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖國神社是日本軍國主義對外侵略擴張的精神支柱。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
sb who sacrifices himself/sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
Checheng township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
